intro: Pristimera indica, commonly known as the Indian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has small, succulent leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability. Pristimera indica is often found in sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
